text: A strong nor’easter could soon hit the East Coast. Here’s what could happen. - The Washington Post
fullText: A swath of the Mid-Atlantic and Northeast, including cities from D.C. to Boston, could face accumulating snow and strong winds.

text: Treasuries Head for Worst Run in a Month on Inflation Fears - Bloomberg.com
fullText: Treasuries are on course for their longest losing streak in a month as growing tensions between the US and Iran fuel oil-driven inflation fears.

text: Hilary Duff Is Ready for Her Pop Return - Rolling Stone
fullText: Hilary Duff takes us inside her incredibly relatable comeback album 'Luck … or Something.'

text: US Jobless Claims Drop by the Most Since November to 206,000 - Bloomberg.com
fullText: Applications for US unemployment benefits fell by the most since November, adding to evidence of stabilization in the labor market.

text: Over 1,000 Kenyans enlisted to fight in Russia-Ukraine war, report says - BBC
fullText: Investigators call the recruitment a well-organised trafficking ring involving immigration staff and security agencies.

text: James Van Der Beek Merch Email Reactions Explained - BuzzFeed

text: Wolves 2-2 Arsenal: Gunners collapse late as title lead starts to slip away - NBC Sports
fullText: Arsenal were 2-0 up and coasting to a seven-point lead in the Premier League title race, before they shipped two goals in the final half-hour and drew last-place Wolves 2-2 at Molineux Stadium on Wednesday.

text: Amid Epstein fallout, Bill Gates becomes point of controversy at India AI summit - CNBC
fullText: Bill Gates has become a point of controversy at a major Indian AI festival this week, amid the fallout of the latest Epstein file release.

text: UN experts say destruction by Sudan's rebels in el-Fasher in October bears 'hallmarks of genocide' - Associated Press News

text: Former Nebraska first lady Susanne Shore runs for NU regent in Omaha - Nebraska Examiner
fullText: Susanne Shore, Nebraska's former first lady under then-Gov. Pete Ricketts, is running for an Omaha seat on the NU Board of Regents.

text: Blood tests show potential for predicting start of Alzheimer’s symptoms - The Washington Post
fullText: The technique is not yet precise enough to predict a patient’s exact trajectory but could help find long-sought preventive treatment.

text: Steve Cohen's $3.4 Billion Payday Tops Hedge Fund Ranks - Bloomberg.com
fullText: The Point72 founder edges Tepper and Englander to take the No. 1 spot in Bloomberg’s annual listing.

text: Canadians kind of hate America now. Our new poll shows just how much. - Politico
fullText: It’s not just about the trade war. Nearly half of America’s neighbors to the north now think the U.S. is a bigger threat to world peace than Russia.

text: How Epstein and Maxwell used an elite Midwest arts school to prey on girls - NPR
fullText: Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell lavished money on the Interlochen Center for the Arts to gain access, documents show — even funding an on-campus lodge they stayed in. In the process, two teenagers were pulled into their orbit.

text: Ilia Malinin says person who came to Olympics a few weeks ago is ‘dust’ - The Washington Post
fullText: Gone is the shy 21-year-old who talked effusively about figure skating, replaced by a young man whose words come in measured and concrete thoughts about a larger purpose.

text: Airbus Shares Slide as Engine Shortages Hit A320 Production - The Wall Street Journal
fullText: Plane maker targets lower delivery goal after latest supply-chain challenge

text: Trump heads to Georgia, a target of his election falsehoods, as Republicans look for midterm boost - Associated Press News

text: Bird flu concerns: Traumatized Hainesport Twp. residents forced to dispose dead birds amid suspected outbreak - 6abc Philadelphia
